summary.en: J is the 10th letter of the English alphabet and can also be used as an abbreviation depending on context.

definition.en: (often written as J) an abbreviation used in names, grades, music, and other labels, depending on context

examples.en: My middle initial is J.
In the US, J can mean â€œjunior,â€ as in â€œMartin Luther King Jr.â€

summary.en: a proposed Pentateuch source associated with the divine name YHWH

definition.en: (Biblical studies) A proposed source behind parts of the Pentateuch, characterized by using the divine name YHWH (often rendered â€œYahwehâ€); also called the Yahwist/Jahwist source.

examples.en: In the Documentary Hypothesis, the J-source is often contrasted with the E-source, which prefers â€œElohimâ€ for God.
Some scholars attribute vivid, story-like passages in Genesis to the J-source.

summary.en: A J-shaped tube, especially one used for feeding directly into the small intestine.

definition.en: A J-shaped tube used to deliver nutrition or medication directly into the jejunum (part of the small intestine), often after certain stomach or esophageal surgeries.

examples.en: After surgery, he received liquid nutrition through a J-tube for several weeks.
The nurse taught her family how to flush the J-tube to prevent clogs.

definition.en: A J-shaped piece of tubing used in laboratories or engineering (for example, to connect parts or guide fluids).

examples.en: We used a J-tube to route the hose around the equipment.

summary.en: J.J. is usually read â€œjay jayâ€ and most often refers to someoneâ€™s initials; more rarely, JJ can mean â€œjust jokingâ€ in texting.

definition.en: used as a personâ€™s initials (the first letters of their first and middle names, or first and last names), often used as a nickname or in writing to refer to someone without giving their full name

examples.en: Everyone calls him J.J. because his name is Jordan James.
The article quoted â€˜J.J.â€™ but did not reveal the personâ€™s full name.

definition.en: (less common, informal, in texting) short for â€œjust joking,â€ meaning the speaker is not serious

examples.en: Donâ€™t worryâ€”Iâ€™m not mad, JJ.
He wrote â€œJJâ€ after the comment so no one would take it seriously.

summary.en: â€œJ.K.â€ most commonly means â€œjust kiddingâ€ in casual messages; it can also be a personâ€™s initials.

definition.en: Used in texting to mean â€œjust kidding,â€ showing that what you said was a joke and not serious.

examples.en: I ate all your snacks. JKâ€”I saved you some.
Youâ€™re the worst. jk ğŸ˜„

definition.en: The letters â€œJ.K.â€ used as initials in a personâ€™s name (for example, an authorâ€™s name).

examples.en: J.K. Rowling wrote the Harry Potter series.
The email was signed â€œJ.K.â€

summary.en: â€œJ.R.R.â€ is a set of initials, most commonly seen in the name J.R.R. Tolkien.

definition.en: (initials) Used as an abbreviation for a personâ€™s first and middle names, especially three names starting with J, R, and R (most famously J.R.R. Tolkien).

examples.en: J.R.R. Tolkien wrote The Lord of the Rings.
The book cover lists the author as â€œJ.R.R.â€ followed by the last name.
